Trial_Design.evidence: A preplanned substudy of a randomised controlled trial.

Participants.evidence: Two hundred and forty-two adult patients scheduled for abdominal surgery at risk of developing PPCs.

Intervention.evidence: High (12 cmH 2 O) versus low (≤2 cmH 2 O) levels of PEEP.

Objective.evidence: To test whether the kinetics of plasma biomarkers are capable of identifying patients who will develop PPCs, and whether the kinetics depend on the intraoperative level of positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Individual PPCs were combined as a composite endpoint. Plasma samples were collected before surgery, directly after surgery and on the fifth postoperative day.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Blood sampling was complete in 242 patients: 120 patients in the high PEEP group and 122 patients in the low PEEP group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Blood sampling was complete in 242 patients: 120 patients in the high PEEP group and 122 patients in the low PEEP group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Increases in plasma levels of TNF- IL-6, IL-8 and CC-16, and a decrease in plasma levels of SP-D were greater in patients who developed PPCs; however, the area under the receiver operating characteristic curve was low for all biomarkers.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The PROVHILO trial, including this substudy, was registered at clinicaltrials.gov ( ).
